column4: Can't get address for smb when i try "mount smb://L103/c$ /windows"
is L103 in your hosts file, or is it resolveable by Samba through WINS or DNS ?
its resolvable through netbios (WINS, i think)
as is, the station is being recognised under network as L103
the $ is required, its a part of the share name
makes it appear hidden (its the hidden administrative share)
hmm ... I don't like NetBIOS and window's pechant for "$"s ... not quite sure ... maybe escape it ... or unhide it
well, gnome can read it fine using SMB://L103/c$
yes ... but that doesn't mean Samba will like the syntax ...
ill test it with mount before i fstab it
any standard VNC client will work
er, is the windows remote desktop a VNC client?
indeed :) Remote X is better though
you have to install an X server on windows (if VNC floats your boats, that's all you need)
very much easier than hooking it into the keyboard and other peripherals directly, plus you can use the desktop itself
what do you mean "over a standard cable provider" you mean VNCing someone's desktop via the internet ?
IE leaving my laptop at home, and VNCing it from my university
it would be tolerable ... but would flood bandiwdth ... it is very difficult to control in that regard
heh im OK with that...
it would flood your Uni's bandwidth too ...
its capped at 75kb/s
per server... so downloading is not that bad
I'd check with Uni admins before I did it ... otherwise you might be accused of a DoS ...
